maml:description.maml:para: Important: This cmdlet is deprecated. Gets an operationalization cluster object.
Gets an operationalization cluster object by name, or by resource group, or by subscription.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a specific operationalization cluster by name.
Gets all the operationalization clusters in a resource group.
Gets all the operationalization clusters in a subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Important: This cmdlet is deprecated. Gets the access keys associated with an operationalization cluster.

The keys for the storage account, container registry, and other services associated with the operationalization cluster are not returned when getting the cluster properties. A specific call to retrieve the keys must be made since they are sensitive information.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The operationalization cluster object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The name of the operationalization cluster.
The name of the resource group for the operationalization cluster.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The Azure resource id for the operationalization cluster.

The name of the resource group for the operationalization cluster.
The Azure resource id for the operationalization cluster.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the secret keys for the services associated with the operationalization cluster.

maml:description.maml:para: Important: This cmdlet is deprecated. Creates a new operationalization cluster.
Creates a new operationalization cluster. This will create a cluster object, a container service if needed, application insights, and an azure container registry.

maml:Description.maml:para: The number of agent nodes in the ACS cluster.
The number of agent nodes in the ACS cluster.
The URI to the azure container registry to use instead of creating one.
The ACS cluster's orchestrator service principal id.
The operationalization cluster type.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The number of master nodes in the ACS cluster.
Additional properties for the global service configuration.
The configuration ETag for updates.
The operationalization cluster's location.
The number of master nodes in the ACS cluster.
The name of the operationalization cluster.
The ACS cluster's orchestrator type.
The name of the resource group for the operationalization cluster.
The ACS cluster's orchestrator service principal secret.
The SSL certificate data in PEM format encoded as base64 string.
The CName for the SSL certificate.
The SSL key data in PEM format encoded as base64 string.
SSL status. Possible values are 'Enabled' and 'Disabled'.
The URI to the storage account to use instead of creating one.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzMlOpCluster -ResourceGroupName my-group -Name my-cluster -Location "East US 2" -ClusterType "ACS" -OrchestratorType "Kubernetes" -ClientId "abc" -Secret "xyz"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new operationalization cluster with azure container service and Kubernetes as the orchestrator.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzMlOpCluster -ResourceGroupName my-group -Name my-cluster -Location "East US 2" -ClusterType "Local"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new operationalization cluster locally. This creates an azure container registry, application insights, and storage account, but does not create a container service.

maml:description.maml:para: Important: This cmdlet is deprecated. Removes an operationalization cluster.

Removes an operationalization cluster. Some resources associated with the cluster might not all be removed. For example, the Azure container service will get removed, but the associated VMs do not. The storage account, container registry, and application insights are not removed for diagnostic information.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Removes all resources that were created with the cluster.
The operationalization cluster object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Removes all resources that were created with the cluster.

The name of the resource group for the operationalization cluster.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzMlOpCluster -ResourceGroupName my-group -Name my-cluster | Remove-AzMlOpCluster

maml:description.maml:para: Important: This cmdlet is deprecated. Sets the properties of an operationalization cluster.

Sets all the properties of an operationalization cluster. Since it sets all the properties when using a cluster object a fully valid input object must be passed. Read-only properties will be ignored. Only some properties are currently updatable, as shown in the parameter sets.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $cluster = Get-AzMlOpCluster -ResourceGroupName my-rg -ClusterName my-cluster PS C:\> $cluster.ContainerService.AgentCount = 5 PS C:\> Set-AzMlOpCluster -InputObject $cluster

maml:description.maml:para: Important: This cmdlet is deprecated. Checks if there are updates available for the system services associated with an operationalization cluster.
System services receive updates independently from the operationalization cluster. Using this cmdlet will let the user know if Invoke-AzMlOpClusterSystemServicesUpdate.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The operationalization cluster object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The name of the operationalization cluster.
The name of the resource group for the operationalization cluster.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The Azure resource id for the operationalization cluster.

The Azure resource id for the operationalization cluster.

maml:description.maml:para: Important: This cmdlet is deprecated. Starts an update on the operationalization cluster's system services.

The system services can be updated independently from the operationalization cluster. To start an update on the system services use this cmdlet. If no update is available an update will still be started and will return successfully. Once the update is finished it reports when it started, finished, and if it was successful.
